Name: Triple J Farms

Name: Pembroke Farmland Restoration
more Detail: working towards restoring at least 1,000 acres of farmland
Short description/additional Details: Pembroke Township, Illinois, was once the home of the largest Black farming community North of the Mason-Dixon Line. Founded in the 1860s by runaway slaves, Pap and Mary Eliza Tetter, Pembroke Township became a Black agricultural hub.

Name: WILDSEED
Short description/additional Details: We are a collective of people committed to stewarding this incredible resource as a permanent safe space for the sustenance and strength of our movement community, and a site of belonging for people historically disenfranchised from land. Short description/additional Details: Ogema Organics is a native food sovereignty initiative on White Earth, or Gaa-waabaabiganikaag. Our initiative strives to drive the transition from food dependence to food independence.

Short description/additional Details: Live Organically, is a woman black-owned Minnesota business, we currently own and operate five acres of land in Oak Grove, MN. Our mission is to produce quality food that sustains the natural environment and the communities we serve.

Name: Cherry Hill Urban Community Garden
